docs.text:
Example.jl Documentation


#


Epi.crossTable
 
 
Method
.


crossTable(x, y; row=true, column=false)





Make cross-tabulation table between arrays 
x
 and 
y
. 


Optional 
row
 and 
column
 report row and column percentage respectively (not yet implemented).


Return table of complete cases only, i.e., missing values are removed.


source


#


Epi.colSum
 
 
Method
.


colSum(A)





Calculate column sum for two dimensional array 
A
.




Until a better comes...




source


#


Epi.rowSum
 
 
Method
.


rowSum(A)





Calculate row sum for two dimensional array 
A
.




Until a better comes...




source


#


Epi.removeMissing
 
 
Method
.


removeMissing(A; cols=missing)





Removing missing values in an array 
A
. By default remove all rows with missing values in 
any of the columns
. Otherwise removing only missing data only in those columns specified by 
cols
.


Return the modified 
A
.


source


#


Epi.unlist
 
 
Method
.


unlist(A; unify=false)


R's style 'unlist''. 
A
 can be a 1-dimensional array of arrays (the motivation of this function), or a 2-dimensional array (not tested exhaustively).


unify=true
 wraps the result in the 
unique()
 function before return.


source

Optional  row  and  column  report row and column percentage respectively (not yet implemented).  Return table of complete cases only, i.e., missing values are removed.  source  #  Epi.colSum     Method .  colSum(A)  Calculate column sum for two dimensional array  A . By default remove all rows with missing values in  any of the columns . Otherwise removing only missing data only in those columns specified by  cols .  Return the modified  A .  source  #  Epi.unlist     Method .  unlist(A; unify=false)  R's style 'unlist''.  A  can be a 1-dimensional array of arrays (the motivation of this function), or a 2-dimensional array (not tested exhaustively).  unify=true  wraps the result in the  unique()  function before return.  source
